item.title: Header <3
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“Sibor, post:9, topic:465218”]Hey Slant, I don’t know if you fixed your problem or not but go to your CSS and find

.menu li:first-child{ margin-left: 5px; }

and replace that with

.menu li:first-child{
margin-left: 0px;
}

That should fix your problem consideriing I did this on my computer in 5 seconds :P[/quote]
Obviously not, that would move the first list item move slightly to the left, which is not the problem.

Already recreated the facebook bar since I last wrote in this topic and I can tell you, it’s inheriting the properties of the parent div, give us the entire code and I’ll fix it

Read full topic

and replace that with

}

That should fix your problem consideriing I did this on my computer in 5 seconds

item.title: Header <3

item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Looks more like it’s inheriting the properties of the parent container, make sure the nav bar comes before any other

tags.

Also search up html resets, would save you a lot of unnecessary CSS.

@Skizard wrote:

Use this:

.menu{ position: fixed; text-align:center; float: left; top: 0; left: 0; font-family:Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size:12px; width:100%; }

item.title: Header <3

@justaguy wrote:

meiscooldude, instead of specifying every element that you want to reset (assuming you want to reset them all) use the * selector.

Read full topic

item.title: Header <3
item.dc:creator: @meiscooldude meiscooldude
item.description:
@meiscooldude wrote:

One of the first things i do when styling a web page is set the padding, margin, and border for every element to 0. This will solve a lot of little problems between browsers [certain browsers have different defaults for these settings on different elements.]

Here is some code to help: http://meyerweb.com/eric/tools/css/reset/

html, body, div, span, applet, object, iframe, h1, h2, h3, h4, h5, h6, p, blockquote, pre, a, abbr, acronym, address, big, cite, code, del, dfn, em, img, ins, kbd, q, s, samp, small, strike, strong, sub, sup, tt, var, b, u, i, center, dl, dt, dd, ol, ul, li, fieldset, form, label, legend, table, caption, tbody, tfoot, thead, tr, th, td, article, aside, canvas, details, embed, figure, figcaption, footer, header, hgroup, menu, nav, output, ruby, section, summary, time, mark, audio, video { margin: 0; padding: 0; border: 0; font-size: 100%; font: inherit; vertical-align: baseline; } /* HTML5 display-role reset for older browsers */ article, aside, details, figcaption, figure, footer, header, hgroup, menu, nav, section { display: block; } body { line-height: 1; } ol, ul { list-style: none; } blockquote, q { quotes: none; } blockquote:before, blockquote:after, q:before, q:after { content: ''; content: none; } table { border-collapse: collapse; border-spacing: 0; }

Read full topic

item.title: Header <3
item.dc:creator: @Slant Slant
item.description:
@Slant wrote:

Hello fellow web designers xD, well i’ve being working on my forums I have found a slight little problem.

Ok so I wanted to add a navbar like facebook how it stretchs over the whole screen, but for some weird reason my one won’t fit the whole screen. See?

21o6jh3.png1024×600

Here is the code I used:

I used this one in header.php

[code=html4strict]

  • Home
  • About
  • Whats New!
  • Products
  • FAQ
  • Support
[/code]

I used this code in style.css

[code=html4strict].menu{
position: fixed;
text-align:center;
float: left;
top: 0;
font-family:Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
font-size:12px;
width:100%;
}
.menu ul{
list-style:none;
background:#2d2d2d;
margin:0;
padding:0;
}

.menu li{
display:inline-block;
float:left;
}
.menu li:first-child{
margin-left:5px;
}
.menu a{
display:block;
padding:10px;
text-decoration:none;
color:#bbbbbb;
border-top:2px solid transparent;
}

.menu a:hover,
.menu li.active a{
background:#3d3d3d;
color:#dddddd;
}

.clearFloat{
clear:both;
}[/code]

If someone could please tell me what’s wrong I would much appreciate it

Read full topic
